etymology.description: Depicts the shape of a spoon or dagger, indicating an object with a handle.
etymology.interpretation: The character 匕 (bǐ, "cane") originally depicts a spoon or dagger, highlighting its application as a tool with a handle, which conceptually relates to a cane.

examples.chinese: 他用匕支撑自己(他用匕支撐自己)，慢慢走过崎岖的小路(慢慢走過崎嶇的小路)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng bǐ zhīchēng zìjǐ, màn màn zǒuguò qíqū de xiǎolù.
examples.english: He supports himself with his cane, and slowly walks along the rugged path.

examples.chinese: 老人依靠匕(老人依靠匕)，缓缓行走在乡间小道(緩緩行走在鄉間小道)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎorén yīkào bǐ, huǎn huǎn xíngzǒu zài xiāngjiān xiǎodào.
examples.english: The old man relies on his cane, and gently walks on the country lane.
